intro: [WRONG START] Styrochaeton cuculliferum, commonly known as the hooded sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color, arranged in spikelets. Stylochaeton cuculliferum thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
